item.title: rTags
item.description: 1. What are rTags and why would you use them? rTags let you jump directly to the definition of a function under your cursor. Modern IDE’s provide this functionality, so why wouldn’t you have it in vim? 2. How to use them? You don’t necessarily have to read the articles from #3 (unless you want to understand what you are doing). All you have to do is run :RBuildTags, Nvim-R will create a tags file in your current directory and vim will automatically read this file each time you open any .
